text.p: SKOPJE, March 27 - These are the leading stories in the Skopje press on Thursday. Reuters has not verified these stories and cannot vouch for their accuracy.
- Macedonian surgeons warn about serious shortage of anesthetics and demand urgent invervention by the health ministry.
- Macedonian interior ministry delegation visits Greece to discuss cooperation in fighting organised crime and actions preventing spill-over of the Albanian crisis.
- Conference on the international military exercise Savior 97 that will be held in Macedonia from May 11-17 within the scope of the Partnership for Peace Progamme ended in Skopje on Wednesday.

- Opposition IMRO-DPMNY has faith in the intentions of Prime Minister Branko Crvenkovski to clear up the TAT scandal and other forms of organised crime in Macedonia, said leader Ljubco Georgievski. -- Mircela Casule, Skopje newsroom +389 91 201196
